text: I think I preferred the creativity of being in an animation studio, just wasn't my thing at the time. I asked a modeller here about what to put in a portfolio/reel if you are aiming for a modelling career. She said if you are planning to get into an animation studio it would help to have some cartoony work in there as well, to cater your reel to where you want to work. Main thing to put in would be props as that's mainly what you would start doing as a junior. Also to get a design (like from pintrest for example) and make it from that. It will show that you can get a design and be able to work with it, which is basically the whole job :slightly_smiling_face: As well as getting into the habit of having a good eye for detail in design. Hope those tips are useful!

hope you are having a lovely week so far :slightly_smiling_face: any questions or thoughts or if you want any feedback let me know! Also, I just started watching this cute show on netflix called Rilakkuma. It's stop motion but I just think its adorable :slightly_smiling_face:
I also just discovered WIA (Women in Animation) they have some cool stuff on their website <https://womeninanimation.org/>
Oh! If you are in the london area, siggraph is doing an event about BZ newest short Ada <https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/blue-zoo-presents-ada-tickets-69176369383>

text: Thanks so much, will try to tailor it more to that. So definitely not just focusing on characters then heh? And yeah definitely! Thank you those are quite useful!
